page.title: 17FLOODING-CAMELS' AREA
page.content: The Wessex Water Authority has proposed a scheme designed to give protection against flooding in the next 50yrs Queen Camel has a weir and sluice by the Old Mill shop. The sluice splits the flow and some water passes into Henshall Brook. Any flooding initially comes from Henshall Brook , but the river is already rising dangerously by this time.The channel along the river is to be improved and localised constrictions widened,the culvert under the main road will be jetted out and desilted.The weir will be lowered and the masonry walling next to the Old Mill will be raised in level.A masonry wall to be constructed across the river will be regulated by stop logs.
